body: Please add this information in an understandable way to the DevGuard Documetation:
title: Improve SBOM Usage Documentation

body: **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** In our rust project we have a lot of dependencies which are dual licensed, i.e. MIT OR Apache 2.0. After selecting one of them, it is only valid until the next run of my CI pipeline. **Describe the solution you'd like** I would like to have that choice persisted between CI runs/devguard uploads, and only appear again, if the license in the override is not there anymore (or has another combination), so I can revise it again. As long as it is still there with the same combination, everything should be fine. **Describe alternatives you've considered** Instead of individual overwrites, it could be nice to have org/group/repo-wide accepted licensed, or a kind of prefered setting (i.e. MIT over APACHE 2.0). **Additional context**
title: License overwrites

```
API response for /api/devguard-tunnel/api/v1/organizations/my-local-test-org/projects/a-local-test-group/assets/a-test-repo/refs/main/dependency-graph exceeds 12MB. API Routes are meant to respond quickly. https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/api-routes-response-size-limit
````

body:
We would like to have a vulnerability database frontend comparable to https://osv.dev/ in our documentation

This consists of two different pages:
- A listing page,
    - which has a hero section to search for packages or cve ids
    - A result components which displays the search results
        -  Each result should render a link to a details page
- A details page for a single vulnerability like this: https://osv.dev/vulnerability/DEBIAN-CVE-2026-24061
    - At some point, the details page will make the risk calculation algorithm transparent, but we don't start with this


DevGuard does already provide all endpoints for this: https://devguard.org/reference#operations-tag-CVE%20Database

`/vulndb`, `/vulndb/{cveID}`
title: Vulnerability Database Frontend

body: This MR adds a new vuln path property to dependency vulns. It adds the path to the hash calculation thus creating new dependency vulns for different paths. This adds the possibility to handle vulnerabilities based on Path and not only on (CVE, Affected component)
title: Migrates to vuln paths

It seems wired that https://api.main.devguard.org/whatwg-url/-/whatwg-url-14.2.0.tgz is missing /api/v1/dependency-proxy in path.

body:
Ref: https://github.com/l3montree-dev/devguard/issues/1571


- [ ] Refactor Vuln data model to achieve more precise dependency and vulnerability tracking
- [ ] Implement more granular marking for affected dependency nodes within the dependency tree false-positives
- [ ] Implement more precise decision statement for vulnerability management
title: Granular Dependency-Path-Vuln-Tracking

body:
# Description
Creating a  system to share vulnerability management decisions between users of Devguard.
This feature is process as part of a master's project.

# Features and tasks
## Granular Dependency-Path-Vuln-Tracking
- [ ] Refactor Vuln data model to achieve more precise dependency and vulnerability tracking
- [ ] Implement more granular marking for affected dependency nodes within the dependency tree false-positives
- [ ] Implement more precise decision statement for vulnerability management
- [ ] Establish Properties of sophisticated decisions for vulnerability evaluation

## Trusted Entities
- [ ] Implement Trust Score and Trust Score data model 
- [ ] Implement UI to register Trusted Entities / assign Trust Scores to Entities (Entities can be either users or organization)
- [ ] Implement Inheritance of Trust Score Values for Users of an organization

## Recommendation Algorithm
- [ ] Implement Trust-Score-Weighted Recommendation Algorithm
    -  Consider decision properties in calculation
- [ ] Implement (Fallback) Collaborative Filtering / Majority-Based Voting System
title: Devguard - Vulnerability Management Information Sharing System

Mainly added:
- src/pages/how-to-guides/security/dependency-proxy/cache-management.mdx
- src/pages/how-to-guides/security/dependency-proxy/malicious-package-blocking.mdx
- src/pages/how-to-guides/security/dependency-proxy/setup-go-proxy.mdx
- src/pages/how-to-guides/security/dependency-proxy/setup-npm-proxy.mdx
- src/pages/how-to-guides/security/dependency-proxy/setup-pypi-proxy.mdx

To keep the pipeline from failing:
- Adjusted package-lock.json (I reran npm install a few times within a commit, because I thought it was some node.js error at first and npm did some changes, that's why there is a single commit with only package-lock.json changes)
- Fixed a default-value-missing-error apart from what the main task of this branch was to allow the pipeline to compile. 

Note: Some pipelines (e.g. sca-scanning and container-scanning) are still failing while scanning, but at this point I am not sure on what end the problem seems to occur.
title: Diataxis how to guides security dependency proxy
